originalText.text: Unprofessional and terrible place. Phone calls are never answered. We scheduled online for our annual visit after calling 10+ times. We showed up for our appointment and were told to wait outside, and they’ll call us in 1 hour to come back because they’re running behind. We did as we were told, waited outside, but received no phone call. We still came back in  1 hour later to find the office closed. This is not how you treat patients. They knew we were waiting well past our appointment time, but they felt that it was fine to close their office and leave. How is this acceptable? I have no idea how this office remains in business with this kind of patient experience.

originalText.text:
These are the absolute worst group of people you can consider for management of your health. It is evident in their lack of organization that there is no cohesiveness in their unit of staff. The amount of inconsistent information I received when trying to get clarification on an issue related to my health and personal medical records truly baffled me. It is really as if they just say the first thing that comes to their mind for the simple reason of having a response; one which they will contradict minutes later if the conversation is held on for long enough. Speaking to four different staff members (including the doctor) was not enough to help my situation since they were more focused on my frustration that stemmed from their staff continually giving me false/inaccurate information regarding when and how I’d get my records at a time I needed it most. When asked why it was so difficult for them to print out the medical records I had almost two weeks asking for, that I also wanted for my own personal keeping, their answers were either “give us the doctors fax and we’ll fax it” or “because we generally don’t print records,” which proved that they were indeed able to do so, but were just not interested in the extra workload of getting it done for me.

Simply put, this facility is filled with staff that seem to be allergic to accountability as they couldn’t admit their errors and the effects of their inconsistencies on my situation when I brought them up. I really wish I wouldn’t have to deal with them, so now I’m left with figuring out ways that I can make that happen. At this point, I can only advise anyone else who is considering working with them to simply not!

originalText.text: I’ll keep this simple. Dr Roedan is the best Dr I’ve ever had by a long shot. I actually look forward to my visits. I always leave feeling so much better in every way. I’ll never use anyone else for me and my family. If you need a great Dr to help you with your health and wellness do yourself a favor and meet this man.

originalText.text: Terrible place. The assistant seems to be calling the shots. Barely ever see Dr roedan. Was supposed to get bloodwork done for a bunch of things and this "assistant" forgot to put in the order so blood was drawn for nothing. Ridiculous. It seems like the owner tries to search patients names to determine if the review is credible or not. Doesnt even address the issues at hand. The hold time is Ridiculous and they're always confused or refusing to help.

originalText.text: Calling into the Practice is so odd...just spanish music for about 8 minutes.  Cool but not very professional.  once someone picked up, she kept disconnecting me.  Beautiful and very expensive website.  But how does one make an appointment with the crazy answering service?  Doubt the docs know.  It's always good to check your business's answering service and experience what it's like to call in as this is the first impression ppl get into your business or practice.  I noticed in one review, as I waited on hold, that someone wrote a negative review about Dr. Socrates Roedan. There was a reply from the practice politely saying there was no one there by that name.  Yet on the  RD Medical website, he is noted as one of the doctors.  (haha..) something appears to be very off about this practice, that suggests more may be happening here than meets the eye.  I couldn't help myself but to keep calling to set up an appointment - OCD or whatever- it was so odd that they kept either putting me on hold only to hand up or when I finally got someone she seemed so confused and dazed about why I was calling.  oh boy.  Best of luck to anyone who ventures into this office.  Buena Suerte!
